fields.description:
Originally reported as https://bobswift.atlassian.net/browse/CSOT-138

One of our COT entries is creating unattached/duplicate/fake subtasks. 
This does not happen every single time we use the transition.
When we run the transition the following happens:
1. The original issue is transitioned
2. Three (expected number) new subtasks are created. These subtasks are not attached to the original issue. They have the correct/expected summaries and are visible when searching for the summary. They are not viewable.
3. Three more subtasks are created. These subtasks ARE attached to the original issue and are viewable.
At this time two things occur. I am not sure which happens first or if one causes the other:
1. Our MS SQL server has a locked SPID that won't let go.
2. The mail queue is stuck trying to send email from the first/bad/malformed subtasks.
We then have to do one or more of the following:
Force the email queue, bypass/delete these emails
Manually kill the rampant SPID.
Restart Jira
After the system has unlocked, the original/malformed three subtasks show as: Issue Does Not Exist

{quote}Well, it is not good news. The linking of the subtask to the parent is taking forever and failing likely related to something else happening on your system{quote}
{noformat}Issue has been created with key: STOR-15691{noformat}
Now link new issue: STOR-15691, as a subtask of parent: STOR-15461
... 6 minutes later
...{noformat}
New issue: STOR-15691, parent issue: STOR-15461
Unexpected exception linking subtask to parent: com.google.common.util.concurrent.UncheckedExecutionException: java.lang.NullPointerException
com.google.common.util.concurrent.UncheckedExecutionException: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.google.common.cache.CustomConcurrentHashMap$ComputedUncheckedException.get(CustomConcurrentHashMap.java:3305){noformat}
This is the result of a single JIRA API call that normally works fine:
{noformat}subTaskManager.createSubTaskIssueLink(parentIssue, newIssue, authenticationContext.getLoggedInUser());{noformat}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36801].
  {panel}

Customers often don't realize that the data stored in custom fields with contexts restricted to an issue type or project will be un-retrievably lost when migrating to a different Issue Type or project. Although the migration dialog shows a summary of changes that will be made to the Issue, including a list of fields that will be removed by migrating, it appears this may not be visible enough.

# I think it's arguable whether it's right for such custom field data to completely disappear from the database as well, because in most use cases a person moving an issue or migrating issue type is not necessarily intending to delete custom field data. Also, whereas other changes to issue fields can be mapped and even reverted in the future, data lost from the custom field cannot be reverted. Perhaps the data can be retained somewhere in the database even though it's no longer available in the new project or issuetype, but that's one of the issues.
# Perhaps there should be some improvement in the migration dialog as well:
* can include a specific warning that the data lost can no longer be retrieved, which the user acknowledges to proceed, rather than simply listing the field in a general summary of changes confirmation screen.
* can include an option in the dialog to modify the context of the custom field to include the target project or issue type, which will automatically update the custom field configuration and avoid the data loss.

*Workaround*
See [this knowledge base article| https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Change+Context+for+an+Existing+Custom+Field+Without+Losing+Old+Data] for the necessary steps to change custom field contexts without losing existing data.
fields.summary: Issue migration dialog and avoiding custom field data loss due to changing context

fields.description:
h3. How to reproduce:
- Start JIRA from a clean instance
- Create two users: One with the default language and one with a different locale than the system default (For example: Japanese or Spanish)
- Make sure that the system default locale is set to English(UK)
- Shutdown Jira and Restart
- Login into jira with the Japanese user
- Go to the dashboard. Make sure that the assigned to me gadget shows no issues assigned
- Login again with the default language user
- [BUG] Go to the dashboard, you will see the "No issues assigned" text in Japanese.

This is also reproducible with the texts in Guide for JIRA administrator gadgets and seems to occur in the project roles and project components pages.

See screenshots attached, notice the spanish text mixed with english.

Note: This has been also reproducible in master (6.3-SNAPSHOT), and in 5.2.11

h3. Workaround:
- Restart JIRA and make sure that the language of the first user to browse JIRA is the same as the system's default language.

fields.description:
After configuring Crowd and running the test, it seems to do a test for the Unique User ID attribute. This attribute is not actually needed for JIRA+Crowd integration, it is only used for LDAP. This could cause confusion for customers who setup JIRA + Crowd.

This does not actually affect the integration between JIRA and Crowd. The users are properly sync'd and renaming users works fine.
fields.summary: JIRA test checks for UUID when connecting to Crowd

fields.description:
h4.Steps to Reproduce:

# Login user with Administer permission.
# In an issue of any type, click on Admin dropdown button in opsbar.

h4.Expected Results:

The drop-down menu should list:

* Add field
* Where is my field?
* Perrmission Helper
* Notification Helper

h4.Actual Results:

"Where is my field?" will sometimes not display.

See attached screenshot.  
It's possible that the way that you arrive at the issue screen could be important - as navigating away and then coming back to the issue can change whether the "Where's my field?" option is now displayed.

h4. Workaround

This seems to occur any time there is no "jql" header request. If you display the issue in the "search for issues" screen, then it shows up, but loading the issue with its standalone URL does not show it. Add "?jql=gibberish" to the end of the URL, and then it shows up again.
fields.summary: Issue Admin Drop-Down Does Not Always Include "Where is my field"

fields.description:
Running the Integrity Checker resulting the following
{quote}UNFIXABLE ERROR: The issue with key SD-2 has a status of Resolved which is not a valid status for the issues workflow.{quote}

Logs showing the following
{noformat}2014-01-30 23:21:06,124 http-bio-8617-exec-1 ERROR admin 1401x2213x1 1yavut2 10.60.2.104 /secure/IssueAction.jspa [atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl] State of issue [SDT-1] has an action [id=51] which cannot be found in the workflow descriptor

2014-01-30 23:21:06,126 http-bio-8617-exec-1 ERROR admin 1401x2213x1 1yavut2 10.60.2.104 /secure/IssueAction.jspa [atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl] State of issue [SDT-1] has an action [id=101] which cannot be found in the workflow descriptor
2014-01-30 23:21:42,223 http-bio-8617-exec-24 ERROR admin 1401x2214x1 1yavut2 10.60.2.104 /browse/SDT-1 [atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl] State of issue [SDT-1] has an action [id=51] which cannot be found in the workflow descriptor
2014-01-30 23:21:42,224 http-bio-8617-exec-24 ERROR admin 1401x2214x1 1yavut2 10.60.2.104 /browse/SDT-1 [atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl] State of issue [SDT-1] has an action [id=61] which cannot be found in the workflow descriptor
2014-01-30 23:21:42,225 http-bio-8617-exec-24 ERROR admin 1401x2214x1 1yavut2 10.60.2.104 /browse/SDT-1 [atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl] State of issue [SDT-1] has an action [id=101] which cannot be found in the workflow descriptor{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a DEMO Project
# Create a new Project using 'Software Development' template (This is to get a different second workflow)
# Create a 'Bug' type issue in Software Development project, and get it to Done
# Open a new tab. Go to Workflow Schemes, edit Software Development project workflow scheme
#* It is required to leave an open page for the 'Bug' issue untouched
#* The 'Bug' issue page must not be refreshed 
# Remove the 'New Feature' Issue type from the Workflow scheme, click Publish and associate the workflow.
# Add workflow to the same scheme of 'Classic default workflow' (Has Closed status instead of Done), choose only 'New Feature' issue type, click Publish and associate the workflow
!wscheme.png!
# Go to the previous tab, the 'Bug' issue page and (without refreshing the page), inline edit the Issue type to 'New Feature'
# Go to Integrity Checker, run them and resulting the following
!ichecker.png!

h3. Expected Results
JIRA should not allow user to edit the Issue type through inline editing knowing that the Status is invalid for the issue type's workflow.

h3. Workaround
# Removing the alternate workflow from the workflow scheme. In this case, removing the workflow associated to 'New Feature' issue type which force it to re-associate the issue types.
fields.summary: Inline edit of Issue Type should not be allowed (not a valid status for the issues workflow)

  {panel}

In Oracle Database there is not a type called boolean. An integer is used instead. This causes problems when generating a JIRA XML backup and restoring it in and instance using another database, as the boolean fields are created as integers when they should be boolean.

This only affects Active Object tables as there is not a column of the type boolean in JIRA database schema.

I have noticed this problems affects the JIRA Agile add-on but it could potentially affect all add-ons which use Active Objects and have a boolean column in their DB tables.

In the 'Services' section, the DVCS service normally looks like this:

!dvcs.png!

The default delay is 1 hour, which seems a long time to wait for commits to show up, so I tried editing it. Only the delay property appears:

and afterwards, all the other properties (pluginJobName, repeatInterval, initiallyFired) have been lost, totally breaking the service:

The same problem applies to all editable services, not just DVCS, which is why I suggest it might be a JIRA (service API) bug rather than a DVCS bug.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36768].
  {panel}

Most modern desktops make it convienient to dock windows to use half a monitor's width.  A very common resolution of new monitors is 1920px wide, so it's quite often that I find myself with browsers at 960px (50% of 1920px, including scrollbars and window borders).

It's a minor annoyance that many UI's expect the browser to be just a bit larger than this.  JIRA is one such product which is very close to working flawlessly, but seems to expect a few extra pixels of width.

For example:
 - Having an item open on the JIRA Agile Boards will hide the "X" close button off the side of the screen

 - On the JIRA Issue detail screen buttons at the far right require side-scrolling to reach, such as the "Log Time" button

As a workaround I often zoom the page to 90%, which is OK but has some side effects with various sites
fields.summary: Ensure JIRA UI is compatible with browsers at 960px (50% of 1920)

fields.description:

  {panel}

I have a JQL search which is supposed to return all issues which I am watching but not the assignee or reporter. The original search I wrote is:

status != closed and watcher = "myusername" and reporter != "myusername" and assignee != "myusername"

However, it appears that the parameter "assignee != "myusername" " does not return issues that are completely unassigned, which means I had to alter the search to be:

resolution = EMPTY and watcher = "myusername" and reporter != "myusername" and (assignee != "myusername" or assignee is empty).

This seems like bad logic to me; if an issue is unassigned, its by definition not assigned to me. Can this be fixed?

fields.description:
* The "Automatic" assignee is represented with an integer value of -1.
* The "Unassigned" assignee is represented with a value of null.
* The default value for the assignee field is "Automatic".
* The assignee-edit.vm field only selects a field by default if it is a truthy value.
* null is falsy.

It is therefore impossible at present to pre-select the "Unassigned" user as an assignee.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
* Set *User Email Visibility* to be hidden
** JIRA Administration > System > General Configuration > User Email Visibility
* Next, open an issue ticket and try to assign it to an user
* Notice that the list of Suggestions will show the string "undefined" (see attached screenshot)

h3. Other Notes
* You can still properly assign the issue to the selected users.
* This only occurs for the *Assignee* field.  It does *not* affect the Reporter field or custom fields.
fields.summary: User Email Visibility Hidden Causes Undefined Assignee

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36757].
  {panel}

Many customers have project keys that are not similar to the project name.
When creating an issue people want to be able to select the project by entering the first few letters of the project key, as well as doing that for the project name.

The proposed change is that the displayed project when creating an issue should look like

Project Name (Project Key)

and that a project should be selectable by typing characters that start the project key as well as the project name.

The test case for this would be a project named "My Test Project" with a project key of "AAA". Typing AAA should offer the project "My Test Project (AAA)"
fields.summary: Show project name and key when creating an issue

Hi there,

I hope this is not a duplicate.

Steps to reproduce:
1/ Start commenting on a ticket but do not click on the "Add" button.
2/ Start editing a comment on the same ticket
3/ Click "Save"
4/ The text that you previously had started to enter in the new comment box has disappeared,

I found this out while when commenting on a ticket I wanted to correct a typo in one of my previous comments.

Cheers,
Olivier

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36750].
  {panel}

Current situation: when there is no explicit tooltip for a suggestion in the dropdown, the dropdown text (for example "Bug" in issue type dropdown) is used for title attribute, and as a consequence for system tooltip.
See attachment in TF-278

Instead we should provide tooltip only when:
- there is significant description different to the text
- text is too long and would not be entirely visible (see JRA-23921)
fields.summary: Single Select suggestions should have a tooltip only when they are not entirely visible
JQL autocomplete suggestion dialog not going away or closed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36748].
  {panel}

JQL does not validate string with dot "." properly. For example, username with a dot e.g. test.user. JQL will show it as an invalid query. This is known to affect versions name as well. 

The string need to be enclosed with quotes before it will be a valid string.

h3. Expected Results
The string will either get enclosed by quotes automatically or it is validated as a valid string without quotes.
fields.summary: JQL does not validate string with dot "." properly
Allow Inline update the fields from Dashboard gadgets

Hey guys,

is there an opportunity to configure the format of the dates in the view of an issue?

We don't like the text with ".... ago". But in administration > general configs and the properties of JIRA, there aren't settings for this.

Same topic here:

Thanks and best regards!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36744].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The Windows installer installs JIRA using a service id of "JIRA" + installation time stamp.
In an enterprise environment this is impractical because you have to change the sevice name after every JIRA update in startup scripts, GPO's etc.

I would like you to change this behaviour so that the installer uses a short service name which doesn't change.


h4. Workaround
To rename the older instance's service name.
# Try to find the older service ID for example: JIRA101214115546
# Replace the ID in the following command and preferred new name for older service instead of "Atlassian JIRA"
{code}
SC Config "JIRA101214115546" DisplayName= "Atlassian JIRA 6.3.14"
{code}
Now your older version has been renamed.
Try to install the new service!
fields.summary: Generalize Windows service name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36740].
  {panel}

Currently we only show when a group is used in:

* Permission Schemes
* Notification Schemes
* Issue Security Schemes
* Shared filters

A more complete list of locations where a group can be used is:

* Permission Schemes
* Notification Schemes
* Issue Security Schemes
* Shared filters
* Project Roles
* Global Permissions
* Custom field values
* Post functions in workflows
* Conditions in workflows
* Shared dashboards
* Filter subscriptions
* Plugins (we can't help check this one, because we don't know how plugins will use this)

We should extend this functionality to check as many places as possible because understanding the impact of changes to groups is very difficult for admins at this time.

You can work around this in part given the queries at: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+identify+group+usage+in+JIRA
fields.summary: Extend Group administration page to show more use locations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36739].
  {panel}

For organizations that re-use Workflow Schemes across hundreds of projects, the new Draft Editing feature introduced in JRA-5254 can be very slow, bringing an instance to its knees.

I think this could catch many admins off-guard. For us with 230 projects re-using a Workflow Scheme, it takes about 20 minutes to finish. Just going to the initial first step (1 of 2) takes about 2 minutes.

There are some slow DB queries as well...this one for example takes 100 seconds and is called 70 times:

{code}
SELECT JI.ID FROM jiraissue JI INNER JOIN OS_WFENTRY WE ON JI.WORKFLOW_ID = WE.ID WHERE ((JI.issuetype=?) AND 
(JI.PROJECT IN (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?,
 ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?,
  ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?,
   ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?,
    ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?,
     ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?,
      ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, 
      ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, 
      ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?,
       ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) )) AND (WE.NAME <> ? )
{code}

I think the risk here is that it could leave some issues in an invalid state if users are actively using JIRA while this long tasks finishes.
fields.summary: Workflow Scheme Draft Editing slow in large instances
Add option for dirty-checking forms when users click the cancel button

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Due to the fix in JRA-12304, on every JIRA startup the database displays additional INFO logging about a change in the database columns. This seems unnecessary to appear on every startup.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Use a non-4-byte character set for your Oracle database.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA starts up without {{core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil}} outputting information about the DB being changed on every startup.

h3. Actual Results

On every startup the following is written to the logs:

{noformat}
2014-01-10 17:58:24,760 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Database Product Name is Oracle
2014-01-10 17:58:24,760 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Database Product Version is Oracle Database 11g Enterprise Edition Release 11.2.0.2.0 - 64bit Production
With the Partitioning option
2014-01-10 17:58:24,760 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Database Driver Name is Oracle JDBC driver
2014-01-10 17:58:24,761 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Database Driver Version is 11.2.0.2.0
2014-01-10 17:58:25,917 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Column "AUTHOR" of type "VARCHAR2" of table "jiraaction" of entity "Action" has different type definition and has been changed from VARCHAR2(255) to VARCHAR2(255 CHAR).
2014-01-10 17:58:26,224 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Column "ACTIONTYPE" of type "VARCHAR2" of table "jiraaction" of entity "Action" has different type definition and has been changed from VARCHAR2(255) to VARCHAR2(255 CHAR).
2014-01-10 17:58:26,243 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Column "ACTIONLEVEL" of type "VARCHAR2" of table "jiraaction" of entity "Action" has different type definition and has been changed from VARCHAR2(255) to VARCHAR2(255 CHAR).
2014-01-10 17:58:26,261 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Column "UPDATEAUTHOR" of type "VARCHAR2" of table "jiraaction" of entity "Action" has different type definition and has been changed from VARCHAR2(255) to VARCHAR2(255 CHAR).
2014-01-10 17:58:26,281 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Column "APPLICATION_NAME" of type "VARCHAR2" of table "cwd_application" of entity "Application" has different type definition and has been changed from VARCHAR2(255) to VARCHAR2(255 CHAR).
2014-01-10 17:58:26,300 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Column "LOWER_APPLICATION_NAME" of type "VARCHAR2" of table "cwd_application" of entity "Application" has different type definition and has been changed from VARCHAR2(255) to VARCHAR2(255 CHAR).
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Always use the recommended encoding of AL32UTF8 when using Oracle.
fields.summary: Column has different type definition and has been changed from VARCHAR2(255) to VARCHAR2(255 CHAR) appears constantly

fields.description:
Jira is adding a comment to the incorrect ticket when using Issue Detail View.

Steps to reproduce:

# Scroll to JIRA Issues using Issue Detail View
# Click on an issue (issue #1)
# Type a new comment but don't submit it
# Click a different issue (issue #2)
# A warning pops up: "You have entered a comment on this issue. If you navigate away from this page without first saving, the comment will be lost."
# Click Cancel
# Then click Add.
# The page will appear to hang up. And when you go to exit the page it asks if you really want to leave. So it appears that the comment was not added successfully to issue #1. Which is true. However the comment was just added to issue #2.
fields.summary: When adding a comment through Issue Detail View, comment is added to incorrect ticket.
Configurable option to disable create issue popup by user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36727].
  {panel}

As per the [Turning off Form Token Checking|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA043/Form+Token+Handling#FormTokenHandling-TurningoffFormTokenChecking], the ability to turn off Form Token Checking is only available up to *JIRA 4.3.x*.

After that, {{jira-application.properties}} is only used to configure [JIRA Home Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Home+Directory]. No update on how to disable the Form Token Checking anymore as it was totally removed from the documentation and moved to JIRA Plugin Development Page:
* [Form Token Handling|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Form+Token+Handling]

Is there any way to address this ability in JIRA 6.x.x? Included the parameter in [jira-config.properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+JIRA+Configuration#AdvancedJIRAConfiguration-Thejira-config.propertiesfile] but it is not working.
fields.summary: Form Token Checking disable for 4.4.x and above

fields.description:
Users are still able to search for particular add-ons such as JIRA Agile or Tempo Timesheets. However, there's a plugin called JIRA Syntax Highlighter Plugin which cannot be searched for using keywords *syntax* or *highlighter*.

The message "The Atlassian Marketplace server is not reachable. To avoid problems when loading this page, you can disable the connection to the Marketplace server. Click here for more information..." is thrown but not in all cases. For example, if the keyword "russia" is used, no add-ons is found and there's no such message. But if the keyword "language" is used, still no add-ons is found but the message is presented.

This causes inconvenience to users when searching for plugins. If the users do not know that "JIRA Syntax Highlighter Plugin" does exist, they may think there's no such plugin at all.
fields.summary: Cannot find certain add-ons with certain keywords

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36720].
  {panel}

When using the two dimensional filter statistics gadget and adding a Select List as one of the axes, a user can choose to sort either by *Total* or *Natural*. 
Natural sorts by alphabetical order while total sorts by total issues. 
There should be a sort option for sorting based on the *options list* as configured in the custom field itself. 

E.g. say we have the following options configured in the custom field, of the same order:
Very low
Low
Medium
High
Very High

We can't sort them like this using either of the Total or Natural sort options for the gadget.

WORKAROUND:
# Rename the options to have a numerical value in front to reflect the sorting position, and have the gadget sort by Natural.
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget should allow sorting of values as configured in select list custom field

fields.description:
I have some required custom fields which are supposed to pop-up only when the issue type is a "Feature" or "Improvement".

The fields get populated correctly when I am creating the issue, However the same does not happen when I am editing the issue.

For example: 
I have an issue of type BUG and I try to edit the issue and make it of type "Feature", the required fields do not appear when I change it to Feature.
But when I close and edit the issue again the fields are there.

fields.description:
Hello,

Worklog details for a specific issue can be obtained from /rest/api/latest/issue/59022/worklog however it can't be obtained from the search API. The call /rest/api/2/search?jql=createdDate > "2014/1/1"&expand=worklog does not work as I would have expected. No worklog information will be returned.

Please my apologies if this is to be considered a feature request instead in which case feel free to change it to bug.

It would be great if JIRA REST API would return more detailed information for all bugs contained in a JQL. The "expand" parameter works with custom fields but I can't figure how to expand the worklog. Getting the results of the JQL and iterating one issue at a time to get the worklog details is overkilling.

I know you can do this with paid plugins but such functionality I believe should be provided out of the box.

Thanks,

- Nestor
fields.summary: worklog expand not working for REST search API

fields.description:
If I go to Edit an existing Mail Server, for which I previously left the "POP/IMAP Port" field blank, it re-populates with 25. 

If I don't notice it's done this (because maybe I'm in there to switch a password or hostname), and have to spend an hour to figure out why this thing doesn't work, it makes my JIRA-admin self really cranky.  Sure, my fault for not noticing, but please don't supply a default in a field that can be left blank. 

I have a related bug (JRA-36715) which I'll report next, related to leaving that field blank.
fields.summary: Incoming Mail Edit screen constantly supplies 25 as a default

*Steps to Reproduce:*
- Create a test project (I'm creating a project with name JQL).
- Create a "Text Field (< 255 characters)/Single/Multi" custom field called "Text Single" -> Any name
- Assign it to the test project fields configuration context. (or in Global Context)
- Add "Text Search" to projects screens
- Create an issue with "Text Single" = A and Summary = A in the test project.
- Execute JQL - Search:
{code}
project=JQL and "Text Single" ~ A

project=JQL and summary ~ A
{code}
!SearchA.png|width=40%!      !SearchA2.png|width=40%!
- => no issue is found (expected to find the previously created issue)
- Create an issue with "Text Single" = B and search with
{code}
project=JQL and "Text Single" ~ B
{code}
!SearchB.png|width=40%!
- => created issue is found
- Create an issue with "Text Single" = AA and search with
{code}
project=JQL and "Text Single" ~ AA
{code}
!SearchAA.png|width=40%! !SearchCCC.png|width=40%! 
- => created issue is found!


*Expected Results:*
All the query will listed the issue in the issue navigator.

*Actual Results:*
The issue is not listed only for issue with value of A.

*Notes:*
Summary field also give the same result.
fields.summary: Cannot do Search for Single Character of "A"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Due to a change made in JIRA 6.1.6, if there are a lot of projects, then a lot of SQL will be triggered by an issue search. As a result, any functionality which includes a browse project search will run very slowly. This includes some dashboard gadgets, and issue searches. This only happens when there is a permission scheme which allows "Browse Projects" permission for "Current Assignee".

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a JIRA instance with a lot of projects, for example, more than 1000.
# Add some issue search dashboard gadgets
# Load the dashboard

h3. Expected Results

# The dashboard gadgets should load quickly, and not produce much database load for a single page load.

h3. Actual Results

# The dashboard gadgets take a long time to load
# The database is hit with a large number of queries

h3. Workaround

# Remove "Current Assignee" from "Browse Projects" in all permissions schemes
# Remain on 6.1.5 or below until a fix is created
fields.summary: Browse project searches are slow when JIRA has lots of projects

fields.description:
# Start up IE11 in modern (metro) mode.
# Go to an issue and attach a screenshot.
# (BUG) Without explanation to the end-user, the browser is redirected to Oracle's java homepage (even when JAVA is installed).

We can never run the applet in Metro because it needs the Java plugin which is not allowed (even if Java is installed on the box). We need to tell the users they need to switch to the desktop version.

NOTE: There was a similar IE10 bug on Windows 8.
fields.summary: Screenshot Applet redirects to Oracle website in IE11 modern mode

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

-Create a new issue type
-Add "><script>alert('Issue name')</script> as Issue name (mind the qoute at the beginning)
-Add "><script>alert('Issue desc')</script> as Issue Description
-Add /images/icons/issuetypes/genericissue.png "><script>alert('Issue icon')</script> as Issue Icon
-Make sure that this issue type is available on your project.
-Create a new issue
-Alerts, alerts everywhere.
-If you don't see the alerts, then click on the listbox.

So far this can be exploited on these fields : *Issue Type icon/name, Priorities icon/name*
These views seem to be affected: *view issue, create/edit issue, detail view on list view, two dimensional filter statistic gadget (icon field)*



I've been able to reproduce this on 6.08
